items.headline: Dow’s banner day points to investor pivot beyond S&P 500’s top winners

items.headline: Why Target’s price cuts on thousands of items are more than just a sales gimmick
items.summary_en: Coupled with the company’s recent layoff announcement, the price cuts reflect a decisive move by the incoming CEO to change the status quo.

items.headline: Why cutting drug prices is pushing Eli Lilly’s stock to all-time highs
items.summary_en: Even by dramatically lowering the prices of some of its medications, the drug giant is still outpacing its rivals and nearing a trillion-dollar valuation.

items.headline: My friends say it’s weird I’ve kept my finances separate from my husband’s for over 10 years. Should we get a joint account?
items.summary_en: Creating a joint bank account from which you automate your bill payments may help with the surface-level issue of covering utilities. But the underlying problem here is that you don’t feel like you and your husband are on the same team.
